page.title: 20 FARMING
page.content: Most local dairy farmers get up at six o'clock and milk the cows using milking machines,after that they have their breakfast.The machines need to be kept very clean to prevent contamination. A tanker comes every morning to collect the milk,which is stored in a tank.The cowsheds,which get very dirty,have to be cleaned out and fresh bedding put down daily.The cows are milked again at four p.m..Odd jobs need to be done like fencing,building walls up,mending barns and collecting eggs,if they have hens.In winter cows feed on silage or hay.Ploughing is done in the Spring and haymaking in the Summer. Sometimes the farmer has to spray poison on weeds and thistles in his fields. When a cow is going to have a calf the farmer may have to get up in the night to see if it is alright,if not he calls the vet for help.
